data.title: Official Site of Jurassic World: The Exhibition in Manchester
data.meta_description: Jurassic World: The Exhibition immerses you in interactive scenes inspired by the film. The closest you'll ever come to living dinosaurs!
data.text:
HOURS

Operating hours may vary. Please check the ticketing site for current hours of operation or your ticket for entrance time.

Last entry 1 hour before the doors close.

Schedule is subject to change on special days.

Jurassic World: The Exhibition is located at Trafford Centre in the Overflow Car Park (Car Park 7), Manchester, M41 7GF

Note: If you’re coming from within Trafford Centre, exit through John Lewis and go straight down the walkway towards Car Park 7. You won’t miss it!

Google Map →

Tram

Metrolink tram via the Trafford Park Line, which runs direct from Manchester city centre – Tram | Bee Network | Powered by TfGM.

Bus

Buses run from all over the region to our dedicated on-site Trafford Centre Bus Station, for live departures and route information please see here.

Train

Bus and tram connections to the centre can be made from nearby rail stations such as Urmston, Salford Crescent and Manchester Piccadilly: Greater Manchester train network map | Bee Network | Powered by TfGM.

Toilets are available for guests both on our trailer outside the exhibit and inside the mall for your convenience. We advise you to use the restroom before entering the exhibition.

We encourage you to leave valuables, large bags, and other personal belongings at home. For the safety of our visitors and the exhibition, all bags entering or leaving the space, including purses, are subject to inspection.

Permissible Items:

Walkers, mobility scooters, and other mobility aids

Small personal point and shoot cameras, including smartphones

Prohibited Items:

Paints and aerosols

Permanent Markers

Weapons of any type

Food and beverages of any type (including alcohol)

Bikes, helmets, skateboards, Heelys, rollerblades, and non-mobility aid scooters are not permitted

Camping chairs

Professional photo or video equipment

Tripods

Most of our guests take about an hour or longer to go through the exhibition. There is no time limit once you have passed through the entry area, and we encourage each guest to go at their own pace to fully enjoy the experience.

Please make sure to allow time for traffic, parking, and entrance delays.

Please plan to arrive so that we can begin scanning your tickets for admission 5-10 minutes prior to your admission time. Tickets purchased on-site are subject to availability and we strongly suggest purchasing tickets online in advance.

Operating hours may vary. Please check the ticketing site for current hours of operation or your ticket for entrance time.

Last entry 1 hour before the doors close.

Schedule is subject to change on special days.

Yes, we wouldn’t want you to miss the opportunity to capture this special moment! Please make sure to share your experience using #JurassicWorldExhibitionLondon

Professional photography and video recording are strictly prohibited without prior written consent from the event organiser. Even if your camera gear just appears professional, you may be asked to take it out of the exhibit space.

Introduce your kids to an exciting adventure with the Explorer Guide at Jurassic World: The Exhibition. This interactive guide offers fun and educational missions that bring each exhibit to life.

Interactive Missions: Kids can complete missions in each room, making their visit more engaging.

Educational Fun: Learn about dinosaurs and more through interactive content.

Collectible Souvenir: Take the Explorer Guide home as a memorable keepsake.

The Explorer Guide can be added to your ticket order online for £8.00 or you can purchase a Family Ticket with 2 Explorer Guides (2 Adults + 2 Children).

The exhibition is open to kids of all ages. Children up to 16 years old must indeed be accompanied by an adult.

Some information you might find helpful:

We have film-quality baby puppet dinos to see in action and there is also a fossil digging station in one of the rooms.

All larger dinos stay behind fenced-in areas.

Kids come out of the exhibition with all kinds of reactions. Usually laughing, amazed, or running out playfully. Let’s face it – who doesn’t love dinosaurs?

Some will cry or scream. We’ve also had babies sleep through it. It depends on the child.

You can always let an Exhibition Attendant know that you need to leave a room and be placed in the next one if the need arises.

Only at our official ticketing partner ticketmaster.co.uk.

The official and only approved ticketing partners of this show are those listed on this website ONLY. If any tickets are bought or sold through any other platform/resale company, such as Viagogo then the promoter reserves the right to cancel the tickets. The ticket will IMMEDIATELY BECOME INVALID if resold OR OFFERED FOR SALE. If you have tickets and are unable to attend the event, then please get in touch with the ticket agent you purchased before trying to resell any tickets through any resale platform.

Yes, tickets can be purchased on-site at box office kiosks; however, we strongly recommend purchasing tickets beforehand via Ticketmaster due to the possibility of a waitlist.

Tickets purchased on-site are subject to availability and a £2.00 increase, so it is recommended to purchase online in advance.

Flexible Entry tickets allow full access to the experience at any time on your selected date. Standard Access tickets grant you into Jurassic World: The Exhibition at your allocated time slot and allow you to explore the exhibition at your leisure.

If your child has celebrated their third birthday, they will need a ticket to enter the exhibition. Children under age three do not require a ticket and can enter with any paying adult.

We’re proud to be fully accessible for guests with many different disabilities and neurodiversity, and we strive to make everyone feel welcome and comfortable by offering a free companion ticket for customers with accessible needs. Please follow the below procedure If you require a Companion ticket.

Purchase Regular Tickets: Purchase the necessary tickets for yourself / your group through Ticketmaster.

Submit Request Form: Complete the request form within 72 hours of your ticket purchase. Ensure you upload:

Proof of your ticket purchase (ticket confirmation email).

Documentation confirming your accessibility needs from the provided list.

Receive Carer Ticket: Upon verification of your request, your carer ticket(s) will be emailed to the address provided.

Onsite Requests: If you are unable to submit your request digitally, you may do so onsite. Please be advised that this is subject to staff availability and may result in delays.

If you have any other queries regarding accessibility please fill out this form and our team will get back to you.

Bring more than 15 and get £2.50 discount per person!

You can purchase tickets for up to 15 people directly on our ticketing site.

If you want to visit the exhibition with a group of more than 15+ people, please complete the Group Booking Form powered by Ticketmaster.
